fr:title.text: Categorical structure in theory of arithmetic

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Categorical structure in theory of arithmetic

fr:mainmatter.html:p: In this paper, we provide a categorical analysis of the arithmetic theory I\Sigma _1. We will provide a categorical proof of the classical result that the provably total recursive functions in I\Sigma _1 are exactly the primitive recursive functions. Our strategy is to first construct a coherent theory of arithmetic \mathbb {T}, and prove that \mathbb {T} presents the initial coherent category equipped with a parameterized natural number object. This allows us to derive the provably recursive total functions in \mathbb {T} are exactly the primitive recursive ones, and establish some other constructive properties about \mathbb {T}. We also sho that \mathbb {T} is exactly the \Pi _2-fragment of I\Sigma _1, and conclude that they have the same class of provably total recursive functions.
